preserve.英释: to save something or someone from being harmed or destroyed

wildfire.英释: a fire that moves quickly and cannot be controlled

honorary.英释: an honorary title, rank, or university degree is given to someone as an honour

imminent.英释: an event that is imminent, especially an unpleasant one, will happen very soon

solution.英释: a way of solving a problem or dealing with a difficult situation

purchase.英释: something you buy, or the act of buying it

inherent.英释: a quality that is inherent in something is a natural part of it and cannot be separated from it

outdated.英释: if something is outdated, it is no longer considered useful or effective, because something more modern exists

ultimate.英释: the ultimate result of a long process is what happens at the end of it

citation.英释: a line taken from a book, speech etc

classify.英释: to decide what group something belongs to

outweigh.英释: If one thing outweighs another, the first thing is of greater importance, benefit, or significance than the second thing

integral.英释: Something that is an integral part of something is an essential part of that thing

decisive.英释: an action, event etc that is decisive has a big effect on the way that something develops

displace.英释: to take the place or position of something or someone

scarcity.英释: a situation in which there is not enough of something

constant.英释: happening regularly or all the time

transmit.英释: to send out electronic signals, messages etc using radio, television, or other similar equipment

facility.英释: Facilities are buildings, pieces of equipment, or services that are provided for a particular purpose

inaction.英释: If you refer to someone's inaction, you disapprove of the fact that they are doing nothing

workload.英释: the amount of work that a person or organization has to do

property.英释: the thing or things that someone owns

legalize.英释: If something is legalized, a law is passed that makes it legal

profound.英释: having a strong influence or effect

severity.英释: the quality or condition of being severe

disposal.英释: when you get rid of something

unstable.英释: likely to change sud­denly and become worse

diagnose.英释: to find out what illness someone has, or what the cause of a fault is, after doing tests, examinations etc

reserved.英释: Someone who is reserved keeps their feelings hidden

material.英释: a solid substance such as wood, plastic, or metal

tempting.英释: something that is tempting seems very good and you would like to have it or do it

grateful.英释: feeling that you want to thank someone because of something kind that they have done, or showing this feeling

approach.英释: a method of doing something or dealing with a problem

abstract.英释: based on general ideas or principles rather than specific examples or real events

tropical.英释: coming from or existing in the hottest parts of the world

dominate.英释: to control someone or something or to have more importance than other people or things

enviable.英释: an enviable quality, position, or possession is good and other people would like to have it

monopoly.英释: if a company or government has a monopoly of a business or political activity, it has complete control of it so that other organizations cannot compete with it

conflict.英释: a state of disagreement or argument between people, groups, countries etc

permeate.英释: if liquid, gas etc permeates something, it enters it and spreads through every part of it

variance.英释: the amount by which two or more things are different or by which they change

landmark.英释: something that is easy to recognize, such as a tall tree or building, and that helps you know where you are

currency.英释: the system or type of money that a country uses

suppress.英释: to stop people from opposing the government, especially by using force

diminish.英释: to become or make something become smaller or less

athletic.中释: 强壮的；擅长运动的；运动的，运动员的
athletic.英释: physically strong and good at sport

navigate.英释: to sail along a river or other area of water

endanger.英释: to put someone or something in danger of being hurt, damaged, or destroyed

prospect.英释: a particular event which will probably or definitely happen in the future – used especially when you want to talk about how you feel about it

judicial.英释: relating to the law, judges, or their decisions

conserve.英释: to protect something and prevent it from changing or being damaged

convince.英释: If someone or something convinces you of something, they make you believe that it is true or that it exists

election.英释: when people vote to choose someone for an official position

generous.英释: someone who is generous is willing to give money, spend time etc, in order to help people or give them pleasure

identify.英释: to recognize and correctly name someone or something

submerge.英释: to cover something completely with water or another liquid

resident.英释: someone who lives or stays in a particular place

majority.英释: most of the people or things in a group

memorize.英释: to learn words, music etc so that you know them perfectly

interact.英释: if people interact with each other, they talk to each other, work together etc

resolute.英释: doing something in a very determined way because you have very strong beliefs, aims etc

domestic.英释: relating to or happening in one particular country and not involving any other countries

restrict.英释: to limit or control the size, amount, or range of something

cautious.英释: careful to avoid danger or risks

mobility.英释: the ability to move easily from one job, area, or social class to another

obstacle.英释: something that makes it difficult to achieve something

invasion.英释: when the army of one country enters another country by force, in order to take control of it

simulate.英释: to make or produce something that is not real but has the appearance or feeling of being real

spacious.英释: a spacious house, room etc is large and has plenty of space to move around in

cropland.英释: an area of land on which crops are grown

relieved.英释: feeling happy because you are no longer worried about something

inferior.英释: not good, or not as good as someone or something else

nominate.英释: to officially suggest someone or something for an important position, duty, or prize

imperial.英释: relating to an empire or to the person who rules it

hesitate.英释: If you hesitate, you do not speak or act for a short time, usually because you are uncertain, embarrassed, or worried about what you are going to say or do.

criminal.英释: someone who is involved in illegal activities or has been proved guilty of a crime

arrogant.英释: behaving in an unpleasant or rude way because you think you are more important than other people

quantity.英释: an amount of something that can be counted or measured

vigorous.英释: using a lot of energy and strength or determination

numerous.英释: If people or things are numerous, they exist or are present in large numbers.

slightly.英释: Slightly means to some degree but not to a very large degree

dividend.英释: a part of a company’s profit that is divided among the people with shares in the company

hardship.英释: something that makes your life difficult or unpleasant, especially a lack of money, or the condition of having a difficult life

evaluate.英释: to judge how good, useful, or successful something is

feasible.英释: a plan, idea, or method that is feasible is possible and is likely to work

overturn.英释: if you overturn something, or if it overturns, it turns upside down or falls over on its side

eloquent.英释: able to express your ideas and opinions well, especially in a way that influences people

redefine.英释: If you redefine something, you cause people to consider it in a new way

forecast.英释: a description of what is likely to happen in the future, based on the information that you have now

champion.英释: If you champion a person, a cause, or a principle, you support or defend them

division.英释: disagreement among the members of a group that makes them form smaller opposing groups

casualty.英释: someone who is hurt or killed in an accident or war

critical.英释: if you are critical, you criticize someone or something

prestige.英释: the respect and admiration that someone or something gets because of their success or important position in society

enormous.英释: very big in size or in amount

epidemic.英释: a large number of cases of a disease that happen at the same time

collapse.英释: if a building, wall etc collapses, it falls down suddenly, usually because it is weak or damaged

dispatch.英释: to send someone or something somewhere for a particular purpose

wildlife.英释: animals and plants growing in natural conditions

delicate.英释: needing to be dealt with carefully or sensitively in order to avoid problems or failure

footnote.英释: a piece of additional information that is not very important but is interesting or helps you understand something

manifest.英释: to show a feeling, attitude etc

mournful.英释: If you are mournful, you are very sad

strategy.英释: a planned series of actions for achieving something

literacy.英释: the state of being able to read and write

commerce.英释: the buying and selling of goods and services

assemble.英释: to put all the parts of something together

readjust.英释: to make a small change to something or to its position

minority.英释: a small group of people or things within a much larger group

bacteria.英释: very small living things, some of which cause illness or disease

paradise.英释: in some religions, a perfect place where people are believed to go after they die, if they have led good lives

ambition.英释: determination to be successful, rich, powerful etc

opponent.英释: someone who disagrees with a plan, idea, or system and wants to try to stop or change it

dynamics.英释: the branch of mechanics concerned with the forces that change or produce the motions of bodies

criteria.英释: A criterion is a factor on which you judge or decide something

untiring.英释: working very hard for a long period of time in order to do something – used to show approval

contrary.英释: contrary ideas, opinions, or actions are completely different and opposed to each other

accustom.英释: to make yourself or another person become used to a situation or place

irritate.英释: to make someone feel annoyed or impatient, especially by doing something many times or for a long period of time

suburban.英释: related to a suburb, or in a suburb

ideology.英释: a set of beliefs on which a political or economic system is based, or which strongly influence the way people behave

imprison.英释: to put someone in prison or to keep them somewhere and prevent them from leaving

practice.英释: something that people do often, especially a particular way of doing something or a social or religious custom

exertion.英释: the use of power, influence etc to make something happen

paralyze.英释: if something paralyzes you, it makes you lose the ability to move part or all of your body, or to feel it

unbiased.英释: unbiased information, opinions, advice etc is fair because the person giving it is not influenced by their own or other people’s opinions

threaten.英释: to say that you will cause someone harm or trouble if they do not do what you want

distract.英释: to take someone’s attention away from something by making them look at or listen to something else

position.英释: the place where someone or something is, especially in relation to other objects and places

reckless.英释: not caring or worrying about the possible bad or dangerous results of your actions

optimism.英释: a tendency to believe that good things will always happen

puzzling.英释: confusing and difficult to understand or explain

reliable.英释: someone or something that is reliable can be trusted or depended on

maturity.英释: the quality of behaving in a sensible way like an adult

validity.英释: the state of being legally or officially acceptable

relevant.英释: directly relating to the subject or problem being discussed or considered

campaign.英释: a series of actions intended to achieve a particular result relating to politics or business, or a social improvement

shepherd.英释: to lead or guide a group of people somewhere, making sure that they go where you want them to go

schedule.英释: a plan of what someone is going to do and when they are going to do it

withdraw.英释: to stop taking part in an activity, belonging to an organization etc, or to make someone do this

invasive.英释: an invasive disease spreads quickly and is difficult to stop

specific.英释: a specific thing, person, or group is one particular thing, person, or group

indicate.英释: to show that a particular situation exists, or that something is likely to be true

eligible.英释: someone who is eligible for something is able or allowed to do it, for example because they are the right age

momentum.英释: the ability to keep increasing, developing, or being more successful

particle.英释: a very small piece of something

category.英释: a group of people or things that are all of the same type

retailer.英释: a person or business that sells goods to customers in a shop

coverage.英释: when a subject or event is reported on television or radio, or in newspapers

previous.英释: A previous event or thing is one that happened or existed before the one that you are talking about

flexible.英释: a person, plan etc that is flexible can change or be changed easily to suit any new situation

monetary.英释: relating to money, especially all the money in a particular country

sensible.英释: reasonable, practical, and showing good judgment

activate.英释: to make an electrical system or chemical process start working

surgical.英释: relating to or used for medical operations

peculiar.英释: strange, unfamiliar, or a little surprising

lobbyist.英释: A lobbyist is someone who tries actively to persuade a government or council that a particular law should be changed or that a particular thing should be done

detached.英释: not reacting to or becoming involved in something in an emotional way

randomly.英释: Without method or conscious decision; indiscriminately.

stimulus.英释: something that helps a process to develop more quickly or more strongly

ornament.英释: a small object that you keep in your house because it is beautiful rather than useful

shipment.英释: a load of goods sent by sea, road, or air, or the act of sending them

workshop.英释: A workshop is a period of discussion or practical work on a particular subject in which a group of people share their knowledge or experience

watchful.英释: very careful to notice what is happening, and to make sure that everything is all right

periodic.英释: happening a number of times, usually at regular times

colonial.英释: relating to a country that controls and rules other countries, usually ones that are far away

vocation.英释: a particular type of work that you feel is right for you

platform.英释: the main ideas and aims of a political party, especially the ones that they state just before an election

audience.英释: a formal meeting with a very important person

positive.中释: 正的，阳性的；正的，正极的，阳性的；正的，正数的
positive.英释: showing signs of the medical condition or chemical that is being looked for

discount.英释: to reduce the price of something

coherent.中释: （文章、观点等）连贯的，有条理的，一致的
coherent.英释: (of writing, ideas, etc.) easy to understand because it is clear and reasonable

overseas.英释: to or in a foreign country that is across the sea

cylinder.英释: a shape, object, or container with circular ends and long straight sides

prophecy.英释: a statement that something will happen in the future, especially one made by someone with religious or magic powers

emigrate.英释: to leave your own country to go and live permanently in another country

restrain.英释: to stop someone from doing something, often by using physical force

colonist.英释: someone who settles in a new colony

wardrobe.英释: a piece of furniture like a large cupboard that you hang clothes in

gorgeous.中释: 极其漂亮的，极其吸引人的；绚丽的，华丽的

overhang.英释: to hang over something or stick out above it

sequence.英释: the order that something happens or exists in, or the order it is supposed to happen or exist in

survival.英释: the state of continuing to live or exist

religion.英释: a particular system of this belief and all the ceremonies and duties that are related to it

gradient.英释: a slope or a degree of slope, especially in a road or railway

suitcase.英释: a large case with a handle, used for carrying clothes and possessions when you travel

footpath.英释: a narrow path for people to walk along, especially in the country

pamphlet.英释: a very thin book with paper covers, that gives information about something

consumer.英释: someone who buys and uses products and services

coincide.英释: to happen at the same time as something else, especially by chance

devotion.英释: the action of spending a lot of time or energy on sth

striking.英释: unusual or interesting enough to be easily noticed

priority.英释: the thing that you think is most important and that needs attention before anything else

filament.英释: a very thin thread or wire

spectrum.英释: a complete range of opinions, people, situations etc, going from one extreme to its opposite

luncheon.英释: a formal lunch or a formal word for lunch

ruthless.英释: so determined to get what you want that you do not care if you have to hurt other people in order to do it

question.英释: to ask someone questions in order to get information about something such as a crime

locality.英释: a small area of a country, city etc

situated.英释: to be in a particular place or position

bachelor.英释: a man who has never been married

latitude.英释: The latitude of a place is its distance from the equator.

idealism.英释: the belief that you should live your life according to high standards and principles, even when they are very difficult to achieve

calculus.英释: the part of mathematics that deals with changing quantities, such as the speed of a falling stone or the slope of a curved line

stubborn.英释: determined not to change your mind, even when people think you are being unreasonable

drawback.英释: a disadvantage of a situation, plan, product etc

rational.英释: rational thoughts, decisions etc are based on reasons rather than emotions

regiment.英释: a large group of soldiers, usually consisting of several  battalions

overtake.英释: If an event overtakes you, it happens unexpectedly or suddenly.

likeness.英释: the quality of being similar in appearance to someone or something

overlook.英释: if a house, room etc overlooks something, it has a view of it, usually from above

regulate.英释: to make a machine or your body work at a particular speed, temperature etc

modulate.英释: to change the sound of your voice

mischief.英释: bad behaviour, especially by children, that causes trouble or damage, but no serious harm

Catholic.英释: a member of the Catholic Church

charcoal.英释: a black substance made of burned wood that can be used as fuel

handbook.英释: a short book that gives information or instructions about something

adoption.英释: the act or process of adopting a child

snobbish.英释: behaving in a way that shows you think you are better than other people because you are from a higher social class or know more than they do

automate.英释: to start using computers and machines to do a job, rather than people

lengthen.英释: to make something longer or to become longer

acquaint.英释: to make sb/yourself familiar with or aware of sth

tiresome.英释: making you feel annoyed or impatient

confront.英释: (of problems or a difficult situation) to appear and need to be dealt with by sb

paralyse.英释: if something paralyses you, it makes you lose the ability to move part or all of your body, or to feel it

insulate.英释: to cover or protect something with a material that stops electricity, sound, heat etc from getting in or out

minimize.英释: to reduce something that is difficult, dangerous, or unpleasant to the smallest possible amount or degree

contrast.英释: to compare two things, ideas, people etc to show how different they are from each other

overload.英释: to put too many things or people on or into something

graphite.英释: a soft black substance that is a kind of carbon , used in pencils, paints, and electrical equipment

humidity.英释: the amount of water contained in the air

disgrace.英释: the loss of other people’s respect because you have done something they strongly disapprove of

residual.英释: remaining after a process, event etc is finished

producer.英释: a person, company, or country that makes or grows goods, foods, or materials

conceive.英释: to form an idea, a plan, etc. in your mind; to imagine sth

emission.英释: the production or sending out of light, heat, gas, etc.

tolerant.英释: allowing people to do, say, or believe what they want without criticizing or punishing them

merciful.英释: being kind to people and forgiving them rather than punishing them or being cruel

quantify.英释: to calculate the value of something and express it as a number or an amount

petition.英释: to ask the government or an organization to do something by sending them a petition

mistress.英释: a woman that a man has a sexual relationship with, even though he is married to someone else

denounce.英释: to express strong disapproval of someone or something, especially in public

gracious.英释: behaving in a polite, kind, and generous way, especially to people of a lower rank

kilowatt.英释: a unit for measuring electrical power, equal to 1,000 watts

follower.英释: someone who believes in a particular system of ideas, or who supports a leader who teaches these ideas

motorway.英释: a very wide road for travelling fast over long distances, especially between cities

fracture.英释: to break or crack; to make sth break or crack

bankrupt.英释: to make a person, business, or country bankrupt or very poor

civilian.英释: used to describe people or things that are not military

equation.英释: a problem or situation in which several things must be considered and dealt with

adjacent.英释: (of an area, a building, a room, etc.) next to or near sth

drainage.英释: the process or system by which water or waste liquid flows away

overhear.英释: to accidentally hear what other people are saying, when they do not know that you have heard

waitress.英释: a woman who serves food and drink at the tables in a restaurant

radiator.英释: a thin metal container that is fastened to a wall and through which hot water passes to provide heat for a room

magician.英释: an entertainer who performs magic tricks

explicit.英释: expressed in a way that is very clear and direct

stairway.英释: a staircase, especially a large or impressive one

province.英释: a subject that someone knows a lot about or something that only they are responsible for

vicinity.英释: in the area around a particular place

junction.英释: a place where one road, track etc joins another

chestnut.英释: a smooth red-brown nut that you can eat

historic.英释: a historic event or act is very important and will be recorded as part of history

courtesy.英释: polite behaviour and respect for other people

twilight.英释: the time when day is just starting to become night

analogue.英释: a thing that is similar to another thing

wasteful.英释: using more of something than you should, especially money, time, or effort

fastener.英释: something that you use to join something together, such as a button on a piece of clothing

portable.英释: able to be carried or moved easily

shameful.英释: that should make you feel ashamed

initiate.英释: to arrange for something important to start, such as an official process or a new plan

commence.英释: to begin or to start something

refinery.英释: a factory where something such as oil or sugar is made purer

shortcut.英释: a quicker way of getting somewhere than the usual route

metallic.英释: made of metal or containing metal

dissolve.英释: to formally end a parliament, business arrangement, marriage etc

doctrine.英释: a set of beliefs that form an important part of a religion or system of ideas

symphony.英释: a long piece of music usually in four parts, written for an orchestra

sandwich.英释: If you sandwich two things together with something else, you put that other thing between them. If you sandwich one thing between two other things, you put it between them.

heighten.英释: if something heightens a feeling, effect etc, or if a feeling etc heightens, it becomes stronger or increases

souvenir.英释: an object that you buy or keep to remind yourself of a special occasion or a place you have visited

marginal.英释: not part of a main or important group or situation

terminal.英释: a piece of computer equipment consisting of at least a keyboard and a screen, that you use for putting in or taking out information from a large computer

disorder.英释: a mental or physical illness which prevents part of your body from working properly

polarity.中释: （人、意见或观念的）截然相反，截然对立；极性
polarity.英释: a state in which people, opinions, or ideas are completely different or opposite to each other

response.英释: something that is said or written as a reply

desolate.英释: (of a place) empty and without people, making you feel sad or frightened

illusion.英释: an idea or opinion that is wrong, especially about yourself

pregnant.中释: 怀孕的；意义深长的；意义深长的
pregnant.英释: (of a woman or female animal) having a baby or young animal developing inside her/its body

traverse.英释: to move across, over, or through something, especially an area of land or water

applause.英释: the sound of many people hitting their hands together and shouting, to show that they have enjoyed something

skeleton.英释: the structure consisting of all the bones in a human or animal body

earnings.英释: the money that you receive for the work that you do

energize.英释: to supply power or energy to a machine, an atom, etc.

appendix.英释: a part at the end of a book containing additional information

obedient.英释: always doing what you are told to do, or what the law, a rule etc says you must do

Buddhism.英释: a religion of east and central Asia, based on the teaching of Gautama Buddha

dedicate.英释: to give all your attention and effort to one particular thing

windmill.英释: a building or structure with parts that turn around in the wind, used for producing electrical power or crushing grain

fraction.英释: a part of a whole number in mathematics, such as ½ or ¾

gangster.英释: a member of a violent group of criminals

aviation.英释: the science or practice of flying in aircraft

handicap.英释: to make it difficult for someone to do something that they want or need to do

detector.英释: a machine or piece of equipment that finds or measures something

shortage.英释: a situation in which there is not enough of something that people need

distinct.英释: easily or clearly heard, seen, felt, etc.

dictator.英释: a ruler who has complete power over a country, especially one whose power has been gained by force

mobilize.英释: to encourage people to support something in an active way

location.英释: the act of finding the position of something

pressure.英释: a condition of the air in the Earth’s atmosphere , which affects the weather

basement.英释: a room or area in a building that is under the level of the ground

mortgage.英释: to give a bank, etc. the legal right to own your house, land, etc. if you do not pay the money back that you have borrowed from the bank to buy the house or land

morality.英释: beliefs or ideas about what is right and wrong and about how people should behave

delegate.英释: someone who has been elected or chosen to speak, vote, or take decisions for a group

massacre.英释: when a lot of people are killed violently, especially people who cannot defend themselves

infinity.英释: a number that is too large to be calculated

passport.英释: a thing that makes sth possible or enables you to achieve sth

catalyst.英释: a substance that makes a chemical reaction happen more quickly without being changed itself

overflow.英释: to be so full that the contents go over the sides

glossary.英释: a list of special words and explanations of their meanings, often at the end of a book

lipstick.英释: something used for adding colour to your lips, in the shape of a small stick

circular.英释: a printed advertisement, notice etc that is sent to lots of people at the same time

specimen.英释: a small amount or piece that is taken from something, so that it can be tested or examined

shoulder.英释: to accept a difficult or unpleasant responsibility, duty etc

meditate.英释: to think seriously and deeply about something

nickname.英释: a name given to someone, especially by their friends or family, that is not their real name and is often connected with what they look like or something they have done

friction.英释: when one surface rubs against another

wretched.英释: someone who is wretched is very unhappy or ill, and you feel sorry for them

improper.英释: not sensible, right, or fair in a particular situation

impurity.英释: a substance of a low quality that is contained in or mixed with something else, making it less pure

strength.英释: the number of people in a team, army etc

advocate.英释: a person who defends sb in court

firework.英释: a small container filled with powder that burns or explodes to produce coloured lights and noise in the sky

announce.英释: to officially tell people that someone has arrived at a particular place

fortress.英释: a large strong building used for defending an important place

baseball.英释: an outdoor game between two teams of nine players, in which players try to get points by hitting a ball and running around four bases

tabulate.英释: to arrange figures or information together in a set or a list, so that they can be easily compared

pathetic.英释: making you feel pity or sympathy

pendulum.英释: a long metal stick with a weight at the bottom that swings regularly from side to side to control the working of a clock

outbreak.英释: the sudden start of sth unpleasant, especially violence or a disease

disperse.英释: if a group of people disperse or are dispersed, they go away in different directions

clearing.英释: a small area in a forest where there are no trees

software.英释: the sets of programs that tell a computer how to do a particular job

solidify.英释: to become solid or make something solid

ridicule.英释: unkind laughter or remarks that are intended to make someone or something seem stupid

endeavor.英释: an attempt to do something new or difficult

scramble.英释: a difficult climb in which you have to use your hands to help you

bulletin.英释: an official statement that tells people about something important
